session_learnings.sum: keywrd reads ONLY json body - never header
session_learnings.detail: Hard architectural boundary. Body is raw extracted content only. Header contains calculated fields, derivative metadata, file paths, processing artifacts that generate false positive keywords.

session_learnings.sum: cait appends inline, never modifies raw text
session_learnings.detail: Standardizes dates and PLSS by appending normalized values inline next to raw. Original text NEVER modified. Additions clearly marked as enrichments.

session_learnings.sum: cait passes header keywords to end-of-file
session_learnings.detail: Relevant keywords from header context written at END of JSON file and included in keyword counts. Keeps keywrd body-only processing clean.

session_learnings.sum: table preservation in Doksn is CRITICAL
session_learnings.detail: ITD docs contain test result tables, QAMS matrices, commodity specs. Tables ARE the data - map directly to TestResult, QAMS, LU_TestType. Must preserve as array-of-row-arrays with header row identified.

session_learnings.sum: zero IT footprint - MSIX double-click install with tutorial video
session_learnings.detail: User gets MSIX, double-clicks, agrees to licenses, watches install + video tutorial about features and test job setup. No servers, services, ports.

session_learnings.sum: proficiency tracking: review log + good samples
session_learnings.detail: Cait maintains human review log (low-confidence files) and curated good samples for calibration. DB record generation depends on JSON quality.

session_learnings.sum: don't assign humans work the software does
session_learnings.detail: Rebecca gets DB population and QAMS verification, NOT document cataloging. 10,000+ documents are the software's problem.
IGS has 10,000+ known ITD documents. ITD has no count and estimates 10-20 years manual processing. Core value proposition of Doksn.
